examples.prompt:
Given this resume: [{name": "Vardhan Shorewala", "email": "vardhan@berkeley.edu", "links": ["linkedin.com/in/vardhan-shorewala-b85543172/", "github.com/vardhan-shorewala"], "phone": "510-761-1001", "educations": [{"gpa": "3.94", "degree": "Bachelors", "majors": ["Electrical Engineering", "Computer Science", "Business"], "grad_year": "2025", "institution": "University of California, Berkeley"}], 35% in supply-chain optimization", "Diminished upstream API calls by 23x, saving upwards of $100,000 monthly", "Validated software architecture with SNS messages, deploying AWS Cloud Stack through CI/CD DevOps for 50K+ vendors"], "end_date": "Aug 2023", "location": "Seattle, WA", "role_title": "Software Engineering Intern", "start_date": "May 2023", "organization": "Amazon"}, {"skills": {"Ruby": 1, "MLOps": 1, "MySQL": 1, "React": 1, "Fastify": 1, "Polygon": 1, "Solidity": 1, "AI models": 1, "MERN stack": 1, "UiPath RPA": 1, "Material UI": 1, "RESTful API": 1, "MetaMask Snap": 1, "Present", "location": "San Francisco, CA", "role_title": "Algorithm Developer", "start_date": "Jan 2023", "organization": "Blockchain at Berkeley"}, {"skills": {"C": 1, "Ruby": 1, "MLOps": 1, "MySQL": 1, "React": 1, "AkkaHTTP": 1, "AI models": 1, "MERN stack": 1, "UiPath RPA": 1, "Material UI": 1, "Machine Learning": 1, "GAN-based machine learning models": 1}, "impacts": ["Designed a robust RESTful API with the MERN stack and employed Material UI and UiPath RPA to create a user-friendly frontend and interface for Astics, streamlining data storage costs by 15%", "Engineered Ruby and MySQL docker container for Hummingbird, which generated transaction data utilizing CycleGANs and ran optimized SQL queries to identify previous fraudulent transactions, catapulting detection accuracy by 20%"], "end_date": "Jul 2023", "location": "San Francisco, CA", "role_title": "Software Developer", "start_date": "Aug 2022", "organization": "Codebase"}, {"skills": {"PCA": 1, "AI models": 1, "Machine Learning": 1}, "impacts": ["Worked under Prof. Bouchard (UCSF/LBNL) to understand biophysical properties of neurons by developing tree and density-based clustering models, trimming interference latency of existing AI models by 65%", "Cut dimensionality variance of features by 45% through statistical methods like PCA, modeling noise from quantitative data"], "end_date": "Aug 2022", "location": "Berkeley, CA", "role_title": "Machine Learning Research Assistant", "start_date": "Jan 2022", "organization": "University of California, Berkeley"}, {"skills": {"AI models": 1, "Machine Learning": 1, "GAN-based machine learning models": 1}, "impacts": ["Devised a novel density-based clustering algorithm for detection of anomalous data points in high-dimensional spaces and big data sets, with ongoing efforts to improve results with GAN-based machine learning models", "Slashed cluster variance by 58% and improved accuracy by 22%, utilizing statistics for data-driven quantitative analytics"], "end_date": "Oct 2022", "location": "Mumbai, India", "role_title": "Machine Learning Research Lead", "start_date": "Sep 2021", "organization": "IEEE"}, {"skills": {"S3": 1, "AWS": 1, "EC2": 1, "MLOps": 1, "OpenCV": 1, "Selenium": 1, "AWS lambda": 1, "TensorFlow": 1, "Kalman filter": 1}, "impacts": ["Implemented real-time user lip coordinate tracking and speech classification with TensorFlow and OpenCV to tackle speech pathology and help individuals with speech impediments, achieving 87% pattern recognition", "Compiled several thousand labeled data points using custom Selenium web scrapers, reducing noise with Kalman filter", "Productionized backend on EC2, with S3 storage buckets and AWS lambda functions, slashing time latencies by around half"], "end_date": "Nov 2021", "location": "Cambridge, MA", "role_title": "Full-Stack Developer", "start_date": "Nov 2021", "organization": "SilverAI"}, {"skills": {"Go": 1, "Flask": 1, "React": 1, "Node.JS": 1, "Postman": 1, "BERT NLP": 1, "Postgres": 1}, "impacts": ["Led team to build a healthcare forum web application on Solana using Go, converting user posts into tradeable NFT tokens", "Incorporated Bootstrap React to create a seamless, personalized frontend and utilized BERT NLP to perform sentiment analysis of comments and posts, boosting concurrent users to several hundreds", "Cut costs by utilizing efficient RESTful Flask and Node.JS APIs on a Heroku server with a Postgres database and conducted rigorous testing using Postman, ensuring robust functionality and stability of data streams"], "end_date": "Aug 2022", "location": "San Francisco, CA", "role_title": "Backend Developer", "start_date": "Aug 2022", "organization": "Faiza"}], "general_skills": {"C": 1, "CD": 1, "CI": 1, "Go": 1, "AWS": 1, "C++": 1, "SQL": 1, "Bash": 1, "Java": 1, "Node": 1, "Ruby": 1, "Flask": 1, "Keras": 1, "Linux": 1, "NumPy": 1, "Docker": 1, "Matlab": 1, "OpenCV": 1, "Pandas": 1, "Python": 1, "VSCode": 1, "Vue.JS": 1, "Postman": 1, "ReactJS": 1, "Seaborn": 1, "HTML & CSS": 1, "JavaScript": 1, "Jupyter Notebooks": 1, "Github Version Controller": 1}, "years_of_experience": 3}],
 and this job description: We are seeking an experienced Backend Engineer to join our dynamic team focused on enhancing and maintaining our cutting-edge payments infrastructure service. As a key member of our technical team, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing the backend systems that power secure and seamless payment transactions. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain robust, scalable, and high-performance backend systems for our payments infrastructure service. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including front-end developers, product managers, and QA engineers, to deliver end-to-end solutions that meet business requirements. Design and implement APIs and microservices to facilitate communication between different components of the payments platform. Ensure the security and compliance of the payments infrastructure by implementing industry best practices and staying abreast of the latest security protocols. Optimize database queries and data storage to enhance system performance and responsiveness. Debug and troubleshoot production issues, and implement effective solutions in a timely manner. Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends to propose innovative solutions and improvements for the payments infrastructure. Contribute to code reviews, documentation, and knowledge sharing within the engineering team. Requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience (minimum of 3 years) as a Backend Engineer, preferably in the fintech or payments industry. Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or Go. Strong expertise in backend frameworks, with preference given to experience in Spring Boot, Django, or Gin. Solid understanding of database design, optimization, and maintenance, with experience in SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience with message queues and event-driven architectures, such as RabbitMQ or Kafka. Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools, such as Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of cloud platforms, preferably AWS or Google Cloud. Demonstrated ability to work in an agile development environment and deliver high-quality software on tight schedules. Excellent problem-solving skills, strong communication abilities, and a collaborative mindset. Would accept or reject the candidate for the provided job? Why or why not? If you are uncertain, you must decide whether to accept or reject based on the information you are provided.
examples.answer: Vardhan is an acceptable candidate for the position of Software Engineer. This is primarily because of his experience in Python, MySQL, and cloud systems like AWS. Additionally, he has worked within Amazon as a software developer, which indicates a strong proficiency in these technologies. He also has a high GPA, and a bachelors degree from UC Berkeley, which is an academic institue known for its strong Computer Science department. One area of concern is that he has not had full time experience yet, and therefore hasn't worked for more than 3 years, but ignoring this quality, he fullfils a lot of the charactaristics of a good fit for the job.

 and this job description: We are seeking an experienced Backend Engineer to join our dynamic team focused on enhancing and maintaining our cutting-edge payments infrastructure service. As a key member of our technical team, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing the backend systems that power secure and seamless payment transactions. examples.answer: Jacob kim would most likely not be a good choice for this job. Firstly, they are mostly a fullstack software engineer, and this position is one for a backend engineer with more focus on backend infra. Their skills do, however, match somewhat with the job description, as they do have experience in Java, but besides that one, there are mostly product or fullstack related roles that the engineer has been a part of, nothing directly that indicates they would be a strong candidate for being a backend engineer.
